job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for an experienced, communicative DEV Engineer to strengthen us in Credit Risk. We are looking for engineers who can push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program. This means thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture. In this chapter we deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing.
       Who are we?
       COO Risk and Finance delivers baseline and change activities for both Risk and Finance. Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING. We play a critical role at ING and will be the go-to function for all kinds of data across the Bank.
       Your main focus
          + Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
          + Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
          + Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications.
          + Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
          + A bank is based on trust of their customers. Therefore, your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
          + Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
          + Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
          + Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
       In addition to developing software solutions, you will contribute to:
          + We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
          + Optimization of the service stability and continuity.
          + Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future. Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
          + In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
       Your work environment
       You will work in the TECH organization of COO Risk and Finance. You will be part of the Vortex team delivering IT solutions and services for the Credit Risk Tribe. The Vortex teams operate according to the Scrum Agile development process. The focus is on high-quality secure-critical software delivered in time. The key development technology used in your squad are Java, Oracle 19, Linux, and Kafka. The Azure DevOps is the single solution used for version control, build, release etc.
job_details.full_text:
DEV Engineer Java

We are looking for an experienced, communicative DEV Engineer to strengthen us in Credit Risk. We are looking for engineers who can push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program. This means thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture. In this chapter we deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing.
       Who are we?
       COO Risk and Finance delivers baseline and change activities for both Risk and Finance. Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING. We play a critical role at ING and will be the go-to function for all kinds of data across the Bank.
       Your main focus
          + Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
          + Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
          + Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications.
          + Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
          + A bank is based on trust of their customers. Therefore, your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
          + Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
          + Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
          + Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
       In addition to developing software solutions, you will contribute to:
          + We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
          + Optimization of the service stability and continuity.
          + Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future. Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
          + In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
       Your work environment
       You will work in the TECH organization of COO Risk and Finance. You will be part of the Vortex team delivering IT solutions and services for the Credit Risk Tribe. The Vortex teams operate according to the Scrum Agile development process. The focus is on high-quality secure-critical software delivered in time. The key development technology used in your squad are Java, Oracle 19, Linux, and Kafka. The Azure DevOps is the single solution used for version control, build, release etc.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software development, data engineering (ETL, data processing), and MLOps principles within a banking context. While it mentions 'big data' and 'calculations', there is no explicit mention of machine learning models, generative AI, or predictive analytics. The core responsibilities revolve around building and maintaining data pipelines, software applications, and deployment infrastructure, which aligns more with a traditional software engineer or data engineer role rather than an ML or GenAI Engineer. The mention of 'DEV Engineer Java' and technologies like Java, Oracle, Linux, and Kafka further reinforces this. Therefore, it does not fit the criteria for ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer and is classified as Ambiguous as it's a technical role but not specifically AI/ML focused.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines' directly relates to data processing, transformation, and loading, which are core components of data engineering.
job_tasks.phrase: Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions dealing with 'big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing', which are all data engineering activities.
job_tasks.phrase: big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications' involves building and integrating software components for data delivery.
job_tasks.phrase: Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications

job_tasks.justification: The statement 'Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product' indicates responsibility for the entire software development lifecycle.
job_tasks.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product

job_tasks.justification: The requirement for software to be 'trustworthy' and keenness to 'learn and apply security standards' points to secure software development practices.
job_tasks.phrase: your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery' is a direct description of MLOps/DevOps practices.
job_tasks.phrase: Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

job_tasks.justification: The statement 'Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process' describes the automation of testing within the CI/CD pipeline, a key MLOps activity.
job_tasks.phrase: Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring' relates to monitoring and maintaining deployed systems, a core MLOps responsibility.
job_tasks.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring

job_tasks.justification: The statement 'COO Risk and Finance delivers baseline and change activities for both Risk and Finance. Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING.' shows an understanding of the business context and its goals.
job_tasks.phrase: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.' describes infrastructure and deployment improvements aligned with MLOps and cloud adoption.
job_tasks.phrase: Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'apply calculations' in the context of big data processing implies some form of data manipulation or modeling, though not explicitly ML or GenAI.
